thread.title: Rockies rip 18 hits, including four homers in routing Cleveland
thread.title_full: Rockies rip 18 hits, including four homers in routing Cleveland

author: Patrick Saunders
title: Rockies rip 18 hits, including four homers in routing Cleveland
text:
$34M Vail mansion boasts three levels of luxury on banks of Gore Creek 
Rockies 17, Indians 6, at Goodyear Ballpark 
GOODYEAR, Ariz. — A Coors Field homer festival broke out in the desert Friday afternoon in the Rockies’ 17-6 demolition of Cleveland. The teams combined for 35 hits, including five home runs. Two of the dingers were grand slams, one by Colorado’s Stephen Cardullo off of former Rockies reliever Boone Logan , the other by the Indians’ Giovanny Urshela off fifth-starter candidate German Marquez. 
For starters: Rookie right-hander Jeff Hoffman , competing for the fifth spot in the rotation, pitched two scoreless innings, allowed two hits, struck out one and hit one batter. 
“I think the last time out there were some tough, unlucky moments, but I thought I threw the ball pretty well,” he said. “I felt good today, but I got myself in a tough spot there, but I was able to work out of it.” 
Hoffman gave up a single to Tyler Naquin in the second and hit Yandy Diaz, but got Richie Shaffer to foul out and induced a double play grounder from Urshela. 
“Hoffman showed some good stuff,” manager Bud Black said. “He’s pumped up about where he is. We view him as a starter moving forward, either out of camp, or at some time. But he’s shown up well so far.” John Leyba, The Denver Post GOODYEAR, AZ – MARCH 03: Colorado Rockies left fielder Gerardo Parra (8) spits out water in the dugout after his first inning score against the Cleveland Indians at Goodyear Ballpark on March 3, 2017 in Goodyear, Arizona. (Photo by John Leyba/The Denver Post) 
Hits: The Rockies had 18 hits. … Gerardo Parra , hitting leadoff, went 3-for-3 with an RBI. … Cardullo, starting in right field, was 2-for-4 with four RBIs. …Catcher Dustin Garneau hit a three-run homer in the seventh and a double in the ninth. … First baseman Jordan Patterson (3-for-3) added a two-run shot. … Cristhian Adames blasted a solo homer to lead off the second.
